definitions.definition: more important, powerful or easy to notice than other things

examples.text: The firm has achieved a dominant position in the world market.
The dominant feature of the room was the large fireplace.
Banks have a dominant role in most countries' economies.
London is dominant within the UK economy.
No one group appears to be overwhelmingly dominant.
The state of the economy has been the dominant theme of the election.

definitions.definition: a dominant gene causes a person to have a particular physical characteristic, for example brown eyes, even if only one of their parents has passed on this gene

wordOrigin: late Middle English: via Old French from Latin dominant- ‘ruling, governing’, from the verb dominari, from dominus ‘lord, master’.
